docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The more affluent Medicare beneficiaries who paid a surtax of up to $800 this year for coverage under the Catastrophic Coverage Act will get that money back under the measure Congress passed last month repealing the program.

headline.main: Medicare Refunds Due on '89 Surtax, but Not Flat Premium

docs.snippet: LEAD: The more affluent Medicare beneficiaries who paid a surtax of up to $800 this year for coverage under the Catastrophic Coverage Act will get that money back under the measure Congress passed last month repealing the program.

byline.original: By MARTIN TOLCHIN, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The AIDS drug AZT has been found to cause cancer in laboratory animals, the drug's manufacturer said today. But doctors emphasized that AIDS patients should continue to take the drug because the risk is still only theoretical.

headline.main: AIDS Drug Causes Cancer in Animals

docs.snippet: LEAD: The AIDS drug AZT has been found to cause cancer in laboratory animals, the drug's manufacturer said today. But doctors emphasized that AIDS patients should continue to take the drug because the risk is still only theoretical.

byline.original: By PHILIP J. HILTS, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Economists say the cost of illicit drugs to American society has risen substantially in the last few years, to far more than $60 billion annually. At the same time they are discovering vast new areas of additional economic impact that they are only now beginning to understand.

headline.main: The Cost of Drug Abuse: $60 Billion a Year

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Shuttling between incubators in the hot, cramped neonatal intensive care ward at Kings County Hospital, Florence Cheri, a registered nurse, rarely enjoys a moment's lull.

headline.main: Nursing Shortage, Wages and Tasks Grow

docs.snippet: LEAD: Shuttling between incubators in the hot, cramped neonatal intensive care ward at Kings County Hospital, Florence Cheri, a registered nurse, rarely enjoys a moment's lull.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Food and Drug Administration, the Federal agency responsible for insuring the safety of food, drugs, cosmetics and medical devices, is facing rising responsibilities with a smaller staff and a budget that has remained almost constant for a decade.

headline.main: Ailing Agency - The F.D.A. and Safety; A Guardian of U.S. Health Is Buckling Under Stress

byline.original: By PHILIP J. HILTS, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ''THIS lab is bugged,'' reads the hand-lettered sign on the door of Eugene Premuzic's laboratory at Brookhaven National Laboratory in Upton. The bugs in question are not transmitters for clandestine eavesdropping, but micro-organisms for cleaning up toxic geothermal energy byproducts.
